paper_abstract: The authors present an analytical model to quantify the performance limits of many-core, heterogeneous systems operating at near-threshold voltage. Reconfigurable logic that supports various accelerators is more beneficial than "dim cores" or dedicated, fixed-logic accelerators, unless the kernel targeted by fixed logic has overwhelming coverage across applications, or the speedup of the dedicated accelerator over the reconfigurable equivalent is significant.
paper_title: IMPLICATIONS OF THE POWER WALL: DIM CORES AND RECONFIGURABLE LOGIC
